tp:docstring.p: The CallManager interface is used to manage call and conference related actions.

Since SFLphone-daemon supports multiple incoming/outgoing calls, any actions involving a specific call must address the method by the means of a unique callID. SFLphone-clients is responsible for generating the callID on outgoing calls. Conversely, SFLphone-daemon will generate a unique callID for incoming calls.
This is the main method in order to place a new call. The call is registered with the daemon using this method.

arg.name: accountID
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the account with which you want to make a call. If the call is to be placed without any account by means of a SIP URI (i.e. sip:num@server), the "IP2IP_PROFILE" is passed as the accountID. For more details on accounts see the configuration manager interface.

arg.name: callID
arg.tp:docstring: The callID is a unique identifier that must be randomly generated on the client's side. Any subsequent actions refering to this call must use this callID.

arg.name: to
arg.tp:docstring: If bound to a VoIP account, then the argument is the phone number. In case of calls involving "IP2IP_PROFILE", a complete SIP URI must be specified.

method.name: placeCallFirstAccount
method.tp:docstring:
Place a call with the first registered account in the account list.
Use this function when you don't have any information about the accounts used (Ex: Firefly mozilla extension)

arg.name: callID
arg.tp:docstring: The callID is a unique identifier that must be randomly generated on the client's side. Any subsequent actions refering to this call must use this callID.

arg.name: to
arg.tp:docstring: If bound to a VoIP account, then the argument is the phone number. In case of calls involving "IP2IP_PROFILE", a complete SIP URI must be specified.

method.name: refuse
method.tp:docstring: Refuse an incoming call.

method.name: accept
method.tp:docstring: Answer an incoming call. Automatically puts the current call on HOLD.

method.name: hangUp
method.tp:docstring: Hangup a call in state "CURRENT" or "HOLD".

method.name: hangUpConference
method.tp:docstring: Hangup a conference, and every call participating to the conference.

method.name: hold
method.tp:docstring: Place a call on hold.

method.name: unhold
method.tp:docstring: Take a call off hold, and place this call in state CURRENT.

method.name: transfer
method.tp:docstring: Transfer a call to the given phone number.

arg.name: to
arg.tp:docstring: The phone number to which the call will be transferred.

method.name: attendedTransfer
method.tp:docstring: Perform an attended transfer on two calls.

arg.name: transferID
arg.tp:docstring: The callID of the call to be transfered.

arg.name: targetID
arg.tp:docstring: The callID of the target call.

method.name: playDTMF
method.tp:docstring: Dual-Tone multi-frequency. Tell the core to play dialtones. A SIP INFO message is sent to notify the server.

method.name: startTone
method.tp:docstring: Start audio stream and play tone.

tp:docstring.p: Sets the volume using a linear scale [0,100].
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: Pulseaudio has its own mechanism to modify application volume. This method is enabled only if the ALSA API is used.

tp:docstring.p: Return the volume value of the given device on a linear scale [0,100].
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: Only enabled if the ALSA API is used, Pulseaudio has its own mechanism to modify application volume.

tp:docstring.p: Join two participants together to create a 3-way conference including the current client.
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: The signal conferenceCreated is emitted on success.

tp:docstring.p: Create a conference from a list of participants
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: The signal conferenceCreated is emitted on success.

tp:docstring.p: Join a new particiant to an existing conference.
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: The signal conferenceChanged is emitted on success.

arg.name: callID
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the call to add to the conference

tp:docstring.p: As the core can handle multiple calls and conferences, it may happen that the client's user leaves a conference to answer an incoming call or to start new calls. This method is used to reintroduce SFLphone-client's user into the conference.
Its put the current call on HOLD or detaches SFLphone-client's user from the another conference.

method.name: detachParticipant
method.tp:docstring: Detach the given call from the conference. If only one participant is left, the conference is deleted and the signal conferenceRemoved is emited.

method.name: joinConference
method.tp:docstring: Join two conferences together.

method.name: getConferenceDetails
method.tp:docstring: Returns a hashtable containing conference details.

arg.name: infos
arg.tp:docstring:
A map containing the ID of the conferences and their states:
ACTIVE_ATTACHED
ACTIVE_DETACHED
HOLD

method.name: getConferenceList
method.tp:docstring: Returns a list containing all active conferences. To update client status, one should use getParticipantList with provided conference IDs.

method.name: getConferenceId
method.tp:docstring: If thsi call participate to a conference, return the conference id. Return an empty string elsewhere.

arg.name: confID
arg.tp:docstring: A string containing the conference ID, or an empty string.

method.name: setRecording
method.tp:docstring: Start recording a call.

arg.name: callID
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the call to record.

method.name: getIsRecording
method.tp:docstring: Tells whether or not a call is being recorded.

arg.name: isRecording
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true is the call is being recorded. False otherwise.

tp:docstring.p: Sets the playback position using a linear scale [0,100].

signal.name: recordPlaybackFilepath
signal.tp:docstring: Once after starting recording for the first time, this signal is emited to provide the recorded file path to client application.

method.name: getCallDetails
method.tp:docstring: Get all the details about a specific call.

tp:docstring.p: A map containing the call details:

method.name: getCallList
method.tp:docstring: Get the list of active calls. To get the call details, iterate on the return value and call getCallDetails method.

method.name: sendTextMessage
method.tp:docstring: Send a text message to the specified call

tp:docstring.p: Notify that a call has been created.
The callID generated by the daemon must be stored by the clients in order to address other actions for this call. This signal is emitted when call haves been created by the daemon itself.
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: The client must subscribe to this signal to handle calls created by other clients

arg.name: accountID
arg.tp:docstring: The account ID of the call. Clients must notify the right account when receiving this signal.

arg.name: to
arg.tp:docstring: The SIP URI this call is trying to reach.

tp:docstring.p: Notify an incoming call.
The callID generated by the daemon must be stored by the clients in order to address other action for this call. This signal is emitted when we receive a call from a remote peer
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: The client must subscribe to this signal to handle incoming calls.

arg.name: accountID
arg.tp:docstring: The account ID of the callee. Clients must notify the right account when receiving this signal.

signal.name: incomingMessage
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a new text message has been received.

tp:docstring.p: Notify of a change in a call state.
The client must subscribe to this signal.

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring:
The acceptable states are:
INCOMING: Initial state of incoming calls
RINGING: Initial state of received outgoing call
CURRENT: The normal active state of an answered call
HUNGUP: Notify that the call has been hungup by peer
BUSY
FAILURE: Error when processing a call
HOLD
UNHOLD

signal.name: conferenceChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Notify of a change in the conferences state

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring:
The acceptable states are:
ACTIVE_ATTACHED: SFLphone user is participating to this conference
ACTIVE_DETACHED: This situation can occur if a call is received while SFLphone user is participating to a conference. In this case, one can leave the conference by answering the call. Other participants may continue conferencing normally.
HOLD: Each call in this conference is on state HOLD

method.name: getParticipantList
method.tp:docstring: Get the call IDs of every participant to a given conference. The client should keep and update the list of participants.

arg.name: list
arg.tp:docstring: The list of the call IDs.

signal.name: conferenceCreated
signal.tp:docstring: Emited when a new conference is created. SFLphone-client is reponsible for storing the confID and call getParticipantList to update the display.

signal.name: conferenceRemoved
signal.tp:docstring: Emited when a new conference is remove. SFLphone-client should have kept a list of current participant in order to display modification.

method.name: holdConference
method.tp:docstring: Hold every call which is participating in this conference.

method.name: unholdConference
method.tp:docstring: Hold off every call participating in this conference.

signal.name: sipCallStateChanged

tp:docstring.p: Call state changed, SFLphone received a notification from registrar concerning this call.

signal.tp:docstring: The SIP or IAX2 message code

tp:docstring.p: Account state changed, SFLphone received a notification from registrar.

arg.name: code
arg.tp:docstring: The SIP or IAX2 message code

signal.name: voiceMailNotify
signal.tp:docstring: Notify the clients of the voicemail number for a specific account, if applicable.

tp:docstring.p: Notify clients of a volume level change.
